data.title: Great authentic Mexican food
data.text: Good local place in Springfield. I had chile rellenos hubby and had a beef burrito. Food was awesome service could be more professional. Our waitress dropped our Togo boxes on the ground right in front of us then picked them up and still gave them to us! We didn't say anything but the sanitary factor should have been common sense.

data.title: Family based restaurant
data.text: Great service, free salsa and chips as an appetizer. Family oriented. Not too busy. Nice food. Not too pricey. A good lunch date.

data.title: Great lunch spot!
data.text: This place never fails when it comes to lunch. Every time I go in we usually get seated immediately. The food is well priced and the lunch menu is very large and is absolutely delicious :)

data.title: I like it.
data.text: The main reason I stopped in here was because they have a parking lot.  I couldn't find a place to park downtown to go eat, so I decided to leave downtown, when I happened upon this place.  Food was great. Service was quick. I would go back.

data.title: New Brunch on Saturday!
data.text:
Hola! is one of those neighborhood eateries that becomes an extension of one's home. Whenever we have guests, we always take them to Hola! for the comfortable atmosphere and great fresh food.

October 31, Hola! added a Saturday brunch on a trial basis.  My husband and I went to sample the new menu.  Since we're vegetarians, and Marco (the owner) knows this, he suggested his Omelet Burrito --- a light, thin omelet wrapped around a filling of fresh avocado, tomato and cheese, smothered in the house sauce, a light picante.  This was served with tortillas on the side and some mango and guanbana nectar and endless fresh coffee.  What a great way to start a Saturday!  

Each brunch features two or three chef's choice dishes.  We can't wait for the next one, to see what Marco has cooked up!

data.title: Awesome Everything!!!
data.text: My husband and I have been wanting to check this place out for a while now and we finally both had a Sat off so we went for a late lunch. The ambiance was adorable and the food was just like the Mexican food we used to get in Colorado!!! The 2 for 1 Margarita's and beer were great and the fried ice cream was out of this world!!! We will definitely go back and bring friends and recommend to others. The staff was friendly and attentive.

data.title: A fun supper
data.text:
Hola is a family run, family friendly place a few blocks from busy downtown Jax. Decor simple, clean and fresh.  The menu featured all our favorite Mexican dishes and beverages
 the frozen strawberry margarita is a big hit.  

 Plenty of food, reasonable prices, and a very friendly and attentive waitress made our dinner enjoyable, even by the two youngest diners, aged 3 years and 18 months.

I had the enchilada plate, four different enchiladas, each with its own sauce. Two other diners had carnitas, and said it was the best thing on the menu.

It was my second visit, and there will be a third visit next time I'm in Jacksonville

..

data.title: Good Mexican food.
data.text: We have been here 3 of the 4 times we have been to Jacksonville. The Mexican food is good and authentic. Service has always been good too.

data.title: Mexican favorite
data.text: Best Mexican place around the area. Food is always fresh and delicious. Lunch is very popular and the lunch specials can't be beat. Chicken quesadilla is recommended. Not the most authentic, but fills the spot.

data.title: Best Mexican food in Jacksonville!
data.text: Great little place. If you get there around noon during the week you will have trouble finding a table. But it is well worth the wait. If you are there at high noon you can hear the noon whistle. The whistle has been a part of Jacksonville for many years. We live at the beach so every time we need to go to downtown Jax we are sure to go to Hola. Just wish they served breakfast!

data.title: not worth the greeting
data.text: "hola!" is cheap and a lot of people like to go there for a quick lunch.  the food is not very good, and still not worth the cheap price in my opinion.  its also always packed, and not worth the wait.

data.title: Always a winner
data.text: There has never been a place like this anywhere I've ever lived.  It looks like a giant ice cream sundae from the outside, but inside is some of the greatest Mexican food you will ever eat.  Usually my sister and I split queso dip and fajitas, but I love love love the chili rellenos.  Their tacos are very good, burritos are excellent-just can't miss at this cozy taqueria!

data.title: Get #38! Friendly, fast, filling, good value, casual, recommended.
data.text:
We eat here when we're in the area and want a quick sit-down meal. Have to get a take out box for half the portion EVERY time, portions are huge. HOLA serves every variety of taco/burrito/enchilada you can think of, with rice/beans/salads, and chips/dips. I always mean to try something new but inevitably order the chicken quesadilla because it is sublime. Light and fluffy yet crispy outside, the tortilla is packed with shredded chicken that has been simmered in mild gravy... the Quesadilla Especial dinner plate I ordered this visit (#38) came with 2 quesadillas and salad (lettuce, tomato, guacamole) and cost just $8.59. My dining partner enjoyed the Burrito Deluxe dinner for $10.89, this included 2 chicken burritos in sauce, with sour cream, salad, rice and beans (#40). Both meals were good plain cooking, made fresh to order. If we came at lunch time the meals would be a few dollars less but the plates would still be piled high. We had nibbled on hot corn chips and cool salsa while we waited for our food, so after one quesadilla each we were too full to get dessert! Pity because the desserts are unusual and tasty. 

This is a casual neighborhood diner, nothing fancy. Eat here for the good plain fresh filling food, do not expect a fashionable romantic venue. I have no clue if the cuisine is authentic Mexican but I like it a lot, and think the food at HOLA is better quality than served in the Mexican establishments mentioned in another HOLA review. You can eat alone here and not stand out: the TV is visible from every table, and is always set to the news channel. You get to take home something for lunch tomorrow :-) Parking lot is huge, decor is Mexican themed, bathrooms are clean. They are always busy at lunchtime.

data.title: Good food and a good value
data.text: This place is a regular on our lunch time rotation and serves good portions of tasty mexican food at a good price.  The salsa is good and the food always comes out hot and fresh.  It is a small place so you have to get there early for lunch if you want to make sure that you get a table inside.  The service is very good anf friendly.

data.title: Taco Bell is better, don't bother if you've ever had real Mexican or Tex-Mex
data.text: Their enchilada sauce is awful, it's not similar to tex-mex or traditional Mexican. The cheese dip is a white queso, not great, chips are sub par, the tea and water tasted funny, the margaritas are just a margarita mix and tequila. Save your money and hit up Taco Bell or chipotle. Also it's hot!

data.title: Deliciousa!
data.text: I love everything about this spot!!!  The food is always wonderful and we always eat way too much, but its just sooooo GOOD!  We started with queso dip, warm chips & salsa.  My friend had a quesadilla, which she devoured in record time with a side of sour cream.  I was only a bit hungry, so I ordered a side of guacamole and a chile relleno.  The guacamole was a mash of green-colored heaven-absolutely sublime!  And the chile relleno here deserves a place among the very best of its' kind...light yet dense cheese-filled deliciousness.  I could have easily eaten a dozen-so light and yet creamy and filling.

data.title: good
data.text: We used a living social deal here:-} Great deal! Food was average and the service was great. Would return. Prices was good

data.title: Good for a quick lunch
data.text:
Hola is located just off of Main street and Phelps, about 2 blocks north of State street. The place is hard to miss, with its colorful exterior. It's small, but the food is good and hearty. If you've been to Olé or La Nopalera, it's about the same level of quality.

I visited with a friend during a lunch break. As far as the service, we were in and out within 30 minutes. Upon arrival, we were promptly seated and greeted. We got our chips and salsa right away too. The food came out within 10 minutes of placing the order, which is just about right.  I had the "Favorite Combo" off the lunch menu. It came with a burrito, beef taco, chalupa, and a beef enchilada. It was a good sized portion for $7.89, and I left satisfied. 

I'll definitely be going back here, since it's close to where I work, and it's quick. If you need a place to have

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: Been here several times, the food is always outstanding and is a fantastic value. Generally when police eat somewhere, you know it's good, and this is no exception. I think there's always been an officer or two dining when we come by.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Great little place to grab lunch downtown.  The food was really good, and reasonably priced.  The service was friendly and quick.
